item.title: Unity and Sonarqube
item.description: Static code analysis is cool: it helps you write better, more robust code, it provides useful insights, and it has exciting numbers and stats that make you feel like a real developer.

item.title: Cookies
item.description: I finally bit the bullet and added a cookie consent popup to the site. Skip to the part where I explain these cookies.

item.title: E3 2019
item.description: Helen, Level 12 Hacker Avengers Video Game to ride the success of Endgame Marvel's Avengers (Dev. Crystal Dynamics.) pic.twitter.com/VrbnlM4zE1 — Matt Kim (@LawofTD) June 11, 2019 Bethesda dudes talking about games

item.title: Awesome Blog: The Old New Thing
item.description: The Old New Thing Raymond Chen’s small posts are equal parts entertaining, terrifying and enlightening. As a renowned Microsoft engineer, he shares very interesting bits of information on a wide number of topics: tricky algorithms, anecdotes from Microsoft, and my favourite topic: explanations of features that made it in the SDK.

item.title: Hello World OS
item.description: A good friend of mine just found an archive of his “operating system”, the “Hello World OS”. It is basically a bootloader, and it gave me such nostalgia that I asked permission to post it:

item.title: Proposal: 1bit file format
item.description: I was recently working with user-editable texture masks, and I was a little surprized when I didn’t find a specialized image file format for 1-bit (monochrome) images.

item.title: Optimizing Site
item.description: So I showed the new site to a few friends, and as expected, they pointed out all kinds of things to fix :)

item.title: Awesome Blog: Digital Antiquarian
item.description: Another awesome blog! Check this: out https://www.filfre.net/ Jimmy Maher writes about early video games in an exquisitely detailed, yet interesting manner.

item.title: github.io
item.description: New Site! I’m pretty excited to try github.io for a personal landing page. I got inspired by Forrest Smith’s post on leaving Medium; he opted for a simple, static website that is easy to control and easier on the user.

item.title: Awesome Blog: Dan Luu (danluu.com)
item.description: I found a great post at danluu.com. I strongly recommend it! The author explores player interactions from male and female perspectives.

item.title: I tried node.js + Heroku
item.description: y So I decided to try NodeJS and Heroku. Heroku is a service that hosts your applications. NodeJS is a… well, you know what it is, right?

item.title: First
item.description: yo man! This is my first post with hugo. i like it so far.

item.title: Pro stuff
item.description: This is basically my CV, but with more pictures :) Images open a gallery, check them out!

item.title: Prototypes and personal stuff
item.description: These are things I made for fun, to try new things, but mostly because they had something to do with my plans to conquer the world.

item.title: About
item.description: Hi! I’m László, I program games in Unity. I like prototyping ideas. I also like spaceships, books, spices, music with guitars.
